abstract: Marubeni Corporation of Japan said on Monday it has agreed to pay $650 million for the stakes held by a unit of BP in four oil and gas wells in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, as the British oil company looks to offload assets in the wake of a massive oil spill in the region.
snippet: Marubeni Corporation of Japan said on Monday it has agreed to pay $650 million for the stakes held by a unit of BP in four oil and gas wells in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, as the British oil company looks to offload assets in the wake of a massive oi...
lead_paragraph: The Marubeni Corporation of Japan said on Monday that it had agreed to pay $650 million for stakes held by a unit of BP in four oil and natural gas wells in the Gulf of Mexico.

headline.main: Marubeni in Deal for 4 BP Wells in Gulf of Mexico
